worklogs.comment:
kou commented on pull request #5080: ARROW-6232: [C++] Rename Argsort kernel to SortIndices
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5080
 
 
   "Argsort" is NumPy specific name. Other languages/libraries use
   different name:
   
     * R: order
       * https://cran.r-project.org/doc/manuals/r-release/fullrefman.pdf#Rfn.order
   
     * MATLAB: sort
       * https://mathworks.com/help/matlab/ref/sort.html
       * "sort" returns sorted array and indices to sort array
   
     * Julia: sortperm
       * https://pkg.julialang.org/docs/julia/THl1k/1.1.1/base/sort.html#Base.sortperm
   
   It's better that we use general name because Arrow C++ isn't a NumPy
   compatible library.
   
   "SortIndices" means "sort that returns indices array". We can add
   "SortValues" or something for sort kernel that returns values array.
   
   "SortIndices" may be easily mistaken for "sort by indices".
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

       compute/kernels/hash.cc
       compute/kernels/filter.cc
       compute/kernels/mean.cc

       compute/kernels/sum.cc
       compute/kernels/take.cc
       compute/kernels/isin.cc
       compute/kernels/util-internal.cc

   I also wouldn't mind keeping "ArgSort". There doesn't seem to be an established general name.

kou commented on issue #5080: ARROW-6232: [C++] Rename Argsort kernel to SortIndices
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5080#issuecomment-522147322
 
 
   Ah, we use "offset" to refer logical index in `arrow::Table`: 
   
   ```cpp
     std::shared_ptr<Table> Slice(int64_t offset) const { return Slice(offset, num_rows_); }
   ```
   
   "SortOffsets", "OffsetSort" or something are better than "SortIndices", "IndexSort" or something.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
"Argsort" is NumPy specific name. Other languages/libraries use
different name:

  * R: order
    * https://cran.r-project.org/doc/manuals/r-release/fullrefman.pdf#Rfn.order

  * MATLAB: sort
    * https://mathworks.com/help/matlab/ref/sort.html
    * "sort" returns sorted array and indices to sort array

  * Julia: sortperm
    * https://pkg.julialang.org/docs/julia/THl1k/1.1.1/base/sort.html#Base.sortperm

It's better that we use general name because Arrow C++ isn't a NumPy
compatible library.

"SortToIndices" means "sort that returns indices array".
